0.title: Rival Samsung is Apple's largest supplier of iPhone 14's OLED display: Report
0.article_body: Samsung Display is expected to account for over 70% of the OLED panels used by rival Apple for the iPhone 14 models by the end of the year, according to a report by The Elec. Apple is expected to use over 120 million OLED panels for iPhone 14, and Samsung is expected to ship over 80 million of those units.

1.title: 18-year-old Indian-origin student stabbed to death outside a school in Canada
1.article_body: An 18-year-old Indian-origin boy was stabbed to death at a high school parking lot by another teenager in Canada's British Columbia province, police said. The victim was identified as Mehakpreet Sethi. The principal of the school confirmed on Tuesday that a fight took place in the parking lot but the victim was not the student of the school.

2.title: Republican urges Twitter CEO Musk to better protect US user data
2.article_body: Republican lawmaker Chuck Grassley has urged Twitter CEO Elon Musk to conduct a threat assessment at the company to better protect Americans' user data. This comes after a whistleblower, Peiter Zatko, testified in September that a foreign agent could use malware to steal Twitter users' personal information. Zatko served as Twitter's head of security before he was fired in January.

3.title: Satyendar Jain withdraws plea to stop media from airing jail videos, to move HC
3.article_body: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain on Thursday withdrew his plea from a Delhi court seeking directions to restrain media from airing any CCTV footage of him from the prison. He said he would move the High Court instead. Recently, CCTV clips showing the AAP leader getting a massage and eating food inside his cell at Tihar jail went viral.

4.title: Kamal Haasan recovering, will be discharged in a day or two: Hospital
4.article_body: A statement from Sri Ramachandra Hospital has informed that actor Kamal Haasan is "recovering well and will be discharged in a day or two". The actor was admitted to hospital on Wednesday. He was suffering from mild fever, cough and cold. On the work front, Kamal Haasan is currently busy with the shooting of 'Indian 2'.

5.title: SRK told me, 'There's grammar attached to each film': Vicky Kaushal
5.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal has said that he learned a "very interesting" thing from actor Shah Rukh Khan. "[SRK] told me there is always a grammar attached to every film and it comes with the director, what vision he has," he added. Vicky stated that it is important for him to understand the grammar that the director is coming up with.

6.title: Agastya reminded me of Abhishek Bachchan: 'The Archies' actress
6.article_body: Actress Tara Sharma Saluja, who will be seen in Zoya Akhtar's 'The Archies', said that her co-star Agastya Nanda reminded her of actor Abhishek Bachchan. "You good naturedly making fun of me on set reminds me of Abhishek and your polite, gentle warmth and talent is endearing," she wrote in an Instagram post. Agastya is Abhishek's nephew.

7.title: CoinDCX publishes Proof of Reserves, CEO says firm to increase transparency
7.article_body: Crypto exchange CoinDCX published its Proof-of-Reserves on November 24. "With this, CoinDCX's on-chain and off-chain asset balances and a complete list of wallet addresses are available for public viewing," the company said in its statement. CEO Sumit Gupta said the company will take more steps towards increased transparency in the coming days, including publishing its Proof of Liability.

8.title: I don't care, not our problem: Ghana coach on Ronaldo's Man Utd exit
8.article_body: Ghana manager Otto Addo said he doesn't know whether Portuguese footballer Cristiano Ronaldo's recent exit from Manchester United is capable of being a distraction for his team, adding that he "doesn't care". "This is not our problem...It's a...big game...so I don't think...this can distract anyone," he stated. Ghana will face Portugal in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener.

9.title: indiagold raises $10 mn from PayU, others in extended Series A round
9.article_body: Fintech startup indiagold has secured $10 million in an extended Series A funding round which saw participation from existing investors including PayU, Leo Capital and Alpha Wave, among others. The company had raised $12 million in the first tranche of the fundraise that took place in August 2021. Two former Paytm executives, Deepak Abbot and Nitin Misra, founded the company.

10.title: Wild dog gnawing on a US-given bone: Kim Jong Un's sister on S Korea
10.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's sister on Thursday described South Korea's new president and his administration as "idiots" and "a running wild dog gnawing on a bone given by the US". Kim Yo Jong made the comments alluding to the South Korean Foreign Ministry's recent statement that it was reviewing additional sanctions against North Korea over recent missile tests.

11.title: I had a huge crush on Sania Mirza: Varun Dhawan
11.article_body: Varun Dhawan revealed he had a crush on Sania Mirza when he worked in a production company on her ad. Varun added Sania asked for an apple. Varun stated Sania's mother assumed he was "crack" as his hands were trembling while giving her the apple. "[Sania's mother] asked 'Who told you to bring...apple?'...[Sania]...said I want the apple," he said.

12.title: India setting benchmark for innovation, has potential to go global: Ajit Mohan
12.article_body: Ajit Mohan, Snap's president of APAC region, said the country is setting the benchmark for innovation and products that don't exist anywhere. The former Meta India head added that a decade ago, India used to refer to successful Western models that could be replicated in the country, but now has a potential to go global with its fairly unique models.

13.title: Financial services tech provider FIS to lay off thousands of employees: Report
13.article_body: Florida-based financial services technology provider FIS plans to dismiss several thousand employees from a workforce that numbered about 65,000 at the end of last year, Bloomberg reported. The move comes after FIS' shares fell 44% this year. The layoffs are reportedly a part of incoming CEO Stephanie Ferris' plan to cut costs by at least $500 million in coming quarters.

14.title: AIIMS Delhi issues guidelines for manual admission till e-hospital server down
14.article_body: AIIMS Delhi on Thursday issued a fresh set of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) which says admission, discharge and transfer of patients will be done manually at the hospital till e-hospital server is down. Notably, the server has been down for more than 24 hours now affecting services like smart lab, billing and report generation of outpatient and inpatient departments.

15.title: Stories about women are far more juicy & entertaining: Ekta Kapoor
15.article_body: Filmmaker Ekta Kapoor said that she has an "absolute belief" that stories about women are "far more juicy...entertaining and far more multi-dimensional than stories about men". "You make stories about women, and you realise the actual meaning of multitasking and navigation," she said. "Homegrown stories about women - I love that kind of storytelling the most," she added.

16.title: Woman, 4-yr-old son burnt alive as LPG cylinder explodes at J&K house
16.article_body: A 40-year-old woman and her four-year-old son were burnt alive after an LPG cylinder caught fire and exploded at their home in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch on Thursday. The deceased were identified as Hamida Begum and Aqib Ahmed. Hamida's husband and two children narrowly escaped the fire, police said. They added that 12 domesticated animals also died in the incident.

17.title: B'luru to host 14th edition of Aero India, Asia's biggest airshow, in 2023
17.article_body: Bengaluru will host the 14th edition of Aero India, which is considered to be Asia's biggest airshow, in 2023. The show is expected to be held at the Air Force Station in Yelahanka, which has been the designated venue since 1996, according to reports. During the biennial airshow, manufacturers and service providers from the Indian aerospace industry meet potential customers.

18.title: Russian parliament passes law expanding ban on 'LGBTQ propaganda'
18.article_body: Russian parliament has passed the third and final reading of a law that expands the existing ban on "LGBTQ propaganda". Under the new law, any event or act perceived as an attempt to promote LGBTQ rights, including films, books or advertisements, will incur a fine. Individuals will face $6,600 fine while legal entities will face $82,100 fine.

19.title: Exporters seek fiscal support, affordable credit in Budget 2023
19.article_body: Federation of Indian Export Organisations (FIEO) on Thursday demanded measures such as creation of a fund and credit at affordable rates in the upcoming Budget to boost the exports and create jobs. During a pre-budget meeting with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, the federation asked for a 200% tax deduction on the expenditure made by exporters for overseas marketing.

20.title: Is this Iran, asks DCW on Jama Masjid banning entry of women going alone
20.article_body: Soon after Jama Masjid barred the entry of women going alone, DCW chief Swati Maliwal said, "Do they think this is Iran, where they can discriminate against women and no one will say anything?" DCW has sought to know the reasons for prohibiting the entry of women and girls "without male companions" to the Jama Masjid.

21.title: Japan's 2-1 win against Germany isn't a big surprise: Jose Mourinho
21.article_body: Portuguese manager Jose Mourinho said 24th-ranked Japan's 2-1 win against four-time champions Germany in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener isn't a "big surprise". "In European football, there is a big focus on the individual...[and on] egos," added Mourinho. "I have coached the best Asian player Son Heung-min and I understand that the mentality is really special," he stated.

22.title: Credit Suisse flags Q4 loss of $1.6 bn, may cut 9,000 jobs by 2025
22.article_body: Credit Suisse said on Wednesday that it projects a 1.5 billion Swiss franc ($1.6 billion) loss in the fourth quarter driven by subdued client activity in the wealth management and Swiss bank division. Bloomberg reported that in a bid to cut costs, the bank has started slashing 2,700 jobs in Q4 and plans to cut around 9,000 positions by 2025.

23.title: Leopard enters residential building near Mumbai, attacks people; video surfaces
23.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a leopard venturing into a residential building in Kalyan near Mumbai. The leopard attacked several people in the area. "The leopard has been kept captive and we're awaiting a cage into which it will be shifted (for evacuation from the site)," an official said. At least three people were injured, as per reports.

24.title: Ramesh Chauhan denies selling Bisleri to Tata Consumer Products, says 'talks are still on'
24.article_body: Bisleri International's 82-year-old Chairman Ramesh Chauhan said that he is in talks with potential buyers for the company, including Tata Consumer Products. Chauhan also denied a report that a ₹7,000 crore deal has been completed with Tata Consumer Products. He added that he is looking for someone to handle the business as his daughter Jayanti is not interested in it.

25.title: BJP committed to bringing UCC once democratic debates are over: Shah
25.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said BJP is committed to bringing the Uniform Civil Code after all democratic debates and discussions are concluded. "Not only BJP [but] the Constituent Assembly had also advised the Parliament and states to bring UCC at an opportune time because, for any secular country, laws shouldn't be on the basis of religion," Shah added.

26.title: Thane civic body seizes 47 kg banned plastic, collects ₹15,000 fine from shops
26.article_body: The Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC), as a part of the plastic ban campaign, took action against 25 shops, confiscated 47 kg of banned plastic and recovered ₹15,000 fine since November 22. TMC took action on shops in Kopri, Uthalsar and Khopat area. TMC is also creating awareness among citizens to avoid the use of single use plastic through various mediums.

27.title: Bankrupt FTX's ex-CEO lists 5 things he wishes he would have done differently
27.article_body: Sam Bankman-Fried, the ex-CEO of crypto exchange FTX that filed for bankruptcy, shared five things he wishes he'd done differently. These include being more skeptical of large-margin positions, examining stress test scenarios and being more careful about fiat processes on FTX. He also regretted not having regular monitoring of core risk metrics and putting more controls around margin management.

28.title: Rohit, Kohli need to change approach, increase strike rate: Harbhajan
28.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and KL Rahul need to increase their strike rate and change their approach. "It is tough when you bat at...[a strike rate of] 110 and...[target] 180," added Harbhajan. "England changed their approach and they have won two World Cups. T20s have to be played like T20s, not like ODIs," he stated.

29.title: Maha Guv has crossed all limits: Pawar on Guv's remarks over Shivaji
29.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday criticised Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari for calling Shivaji Maharaj an 'old idol' and said he has "crossed all the limits". "I think the President and the PM should take a decision (about Koshyari)," Pawar said. "Such people should not be given crucial posts," Pawar said, adding the post of governor represents an institution.

30.title: T'gana minister booked for snatching laptop & evidence from I-T officials
30.article_body: Telangana minister Malla Reddy has been booked for allegedly forcefully snatching a laptop, mobile phone and evidence from an Income Tax officer on duty, according to police officials. A case has been registered under IPC sections 353 and 506 against the minister, officials said. Responding to the allegations, Reddy said, "I didn't tear any documents or snatch any laptop."

31.title: Restores faith in judiciary: NCP on SC questioning EC's appointment
31.article_body: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Thursday welcomed the Supreme Court questioning the speed of Election Commissioner Arun Goel’s appointment. Many questions arose regarding the matter, NCP National Spokesperson, Clyde Crasto, said. "Supreme Court asking for files and showing unhappiness over the appointment during the hearing of petitions restores our faith in our judiciary," Crasto stated.

32.title: Guard felicitated for saving woman who jumped into pond in Navi Mumbai
32.article_body: Sujata Dhole, the Additional Commissioner of Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation, felicitated a security guard for saving a young woman who had jumped into a pond in Navi Mumbai in October. The woman had reportedly jumped into the pond after shouting someone's name. Nitin Kindare, who was on duty in the area, jumped into the pond to save her.

33.title: BJP worker asks to caption Rahul's pic with Rajasthan MLA Divya, she gives 7 captions
33.article_body: BJP worker Arun Yadav shared a photo of Rahul Gandhi kissing Rajasthan MLA Divya Maderna's head during Bharat Jodo Yatra and asked his followers to caption it. Maderna gave seven captions, writing, "Elder brother, protector, guardian". She also wrote, "Shame on you. You might also have a daughter, wife, mother. Stop character assassination. Find some better ways to target politically."

34.title: Madrasas under Uttarakhand Waqf Board to get uniforms, NCERT books
34.article_body: Uttarakhand Waqf Board Chairman has said that all madrasas under it will get a uniform dress code and classes from 8 am to 2 pm like any "regular school". "So far madrasas were known only for Muslim students, but we plan to teach students from every community," he added. NCERT books will also be implemented in madrasas, he further said.

35.title: Drones, crackers banned within 3 km radius of Air Force Station in Gurugram
35.article_body: The district administration has banned the use of drones and the bursting of crackers during wedding ceremonies at banquet halls located within a 3 km radius of the Air Force station on Old Delhi-Gurugram Road. The decision came as the IAF has its ammunition depot at the station. Such activities pose a potential threat to the national interest, IAF stated.

36.title: USFDA classifies Cipla's Goa unit as OAI, product approvals to be hit
36.article_body: The US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) has classified drug major Cipla's Goa plant as 'Official Action Indicated' (OAI). The move will impact product approvals from the facility meant for the US market. According to the USFDA definition, OAI means "objectionable conditions were found and regulatory administrative sanctions by FDA are indicated" during inspections.

37.title: 2 dead, 42 hospitalised due to diarrhoea after drinking dirty water in Chhattisgarh
37.article_body: Two people died and 42 were hospitalised due to diarrhoea after drinking dirty water in Bhilai in Chhattisgarh's Durg district. According to Durg Collector Pushpendra Kumar Meena, drinking water pipeline was laid along drains in most of the colonies under Amrit Mission. Due to this, sometimes harmful elements enter the pipelines and contaminate water, causing problems like diarrhoea, he added.

38.title: PM should speak on BJP's misrule in Gujarat instead of cursing Congress: Kharge
38.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge criticised PM Narendra Modi over his attack on the party during the campaign in Gujarat and said that instead of cursing the Congress, he should speak about the BJP's "misrule" in the state. "Why was the future of children of Gujarat spoiled? Why Gujarat ranks 29th among 30 states/UT in malnourished, underweight children?" Kharge questioned PM.

39.title: 2 domestic helpers sedate guard, 4 dogs to rob employer in Punjab
39.article_body: Two Nepali domestic helpers allegedly gave food laced with sedatives to a watchman and four dogs and decamped with valuables from their employer's house in Punjab's Ludhiana. They stole a gun, 25 live cartridges, ₹2.5 lakh cash, gold and diamond jewellery, and ransacked the house. The house owner was attending a wedding in Shimla at the time.

40.title: All that mattered are gone just like that: Mahesh on father Krishna
40.article_body: In a note, remembering his late father and actor Krishna, Mahesh Babu wrote that his inspiration, courage, and all that he "looked up to" and "really mattered are gone just like that". "But strangely, I feel this strength in me which I never really felt before. I will carry your legacy forward...make you even more proud...My superstar," the actor added.

41.title: BBMP begins 'rapid work' on pilot basis on Old Madras Road
41.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Tuesday began a "rapid road work" on a 500-metre stretch at Binnamangala junction, where 100 Feet Road and Old Madras Road meet. The project, which has been undertaken on a pilot basis, will pave 5-foot-wide, 2-foot-long and 7-inch-thick concrete slabs on the road and is seen as an alternative to white-topping.

42.title: Reformist leader Anwar Ibrahim named Malaysia's next PM
42.article_body: Malaysia's reformist leader Anwar Ibrahim was named the country's new prime minister on Thursday, days after the general elections ended in a hung Parliament. In the elections, Anwar's Alliance of Hope won 82 seats which is below the 112 seats needed for majority. The United Malays National Organization has agreed to support a unity government under Anwar.

43.title: They say they have been silenced, by who: Roy Keane on Germany
43.article_body: Talking about the German players covering their mouths with hands during team photo before their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener against Japan, ex-Manchester United captain Roy Keane said, "They say they've been silenced, by who?" "They can...do a lot more...Leadership's about action, go and do it," added Keane. The German players were protesting against the pro-LGBTQ 'OneLove' armband ban.

44.title: Air pollution caused 2.38 lakh premature deaths in Europe in 2020: Report
44.article_body: At least 2,38,000 people prematurely died in the European Union due to exposure to fine particulate matter (PM2.5) in 2020, the European Environment Agency (EEA) said. This happened when emissions fell due to COVID-19 restrictions. According to EEA, 96% of the EU's urban population was exposed to concentrations of PM2.5 above the level in World Health Organization guidelines.

45.title: RTI portal to help people access information about SC made operational
45.article_body: An online portal for filing Right To Information (RTI) applications to help people access information about the Supreme Court was operationalised on Thursday. At the outset of the hearing, CJI DY Chandrachud said the portal will start functioning soon. "If there is some problem, get back to me…I will be more than happy to look into it," the CJI said.

46.title: Sensex rises by 762 points to close at record high of 62,272
46.article_body: Sensex hit a new high on Thursday and closed 762 points higher at 62,272 points on the monthly expiry day of derivative (F&O) contracts. Nifty ended at a record-high of 18,484.10 points gaining 1.2%. HDFC Life, Apollo Hospitals and BPCL were the top movers on Nifty, while Infosys, HDFC Bank and RIL were the top contributors to the Sensex rally.

47.title: Those who ill-treated people from Bihar are now with BJP in Maha: Aaditya
47.article_body: Ex-Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray has said those who "ill-treated people from Bihar" are now with BJP in Maharashtra. "Everyone existed [under MVA government] peacefully...[Our administration worked] according to the Constitution and the state was moving forward," he said. Thackeray's comments came as he met Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav in Patna on Wednesday.

48.title: Over 6,000 govt schools in Himachal have less than 20 students: Report
48.article_body: A total of 6,106 government schools in Himachal Pradesh have less than 20 students each, according to a report by Unified District Information System for Education. This includes 5,113 primary and 993 middle schools. The report also said that 12 primary government schools do not have any teacher, while 2,969 have one teacher each.

49.title: Udaan raises new debt funding days after $120 mn fundraise & layoffs
49.article_body: B2B e-commerce startup Udaan has raised fresh debt funds from Temasek-backed EvolutionX Debt Capital which is reportedly $35-40 million. Udaan's debt financing in the last four quarters has reached around $400 million. In November, the company fired 350 employees in second round of layoffs which came just days after it raised $120 million in convertible notes and debt from shareholders.

50.title: Hyd Police to impose traffic diversions from Jubilee Hills to Durgam Cheruvu
50.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police is going to introduce traffic diversions on trial basis for vehicles traveling from Jubilee Hills to Durgam Cheruvu in a move to ease traffic movement at Jubilee Hills. The diversions will come into effect from today and will continue for a week. The police also shared list of alternative routes to take during this period.

51.title: ICICI Bank to buy 10% stake in JV between Indian Oil, Chennai Petroleum
51.article_body: ICICI Bank is set to buy a 10% stake in the proposed oil refining joint venture between Indian Oil Corporation Ltd (IOCL) and Chennai Petroleum Corporation Ltd (CPCL). The proposed joint venture plans to establish a petroleum refinery in Tamil Nadu's Nagapattinam, according to bank's exchange filing. IOCL and CPCL will hold a stake of 25% each in the refinery.

52.title: Recession unlikely in Asia-Pacific region in 2023: Moody's
52.article_body: A recession is unlikely in the Asia-Pacific (APAC) region in 2023, although the area will suffer from higher interest rates and slower global trade growth, Moody's Analytics said. Moody's said India is headed for slower growth next year, more in line with its long-term potential. However, inward investment and productivity gains in technology and agriculture could accelerate growth, it added.

53.title: Manchester United co-owner ignores journalist over question on Ronaldo, video goes viral
53.article_body: Manchester United co-owner Avram Glazer ignored a journalist after the latter asked him about Cristiano Ronaldo's exit. A video of the same has gone viral on social media. In the video, the journalist can be heard asking, "Why did he have to leave the club?" after which Glazer ignores him and goes away.

54.title: World's oldest living cat confirmed at almost 27 years old; pics surface
54.article_body: A British cat named 'Flossie' has been recognised as the oldest living cat by the Guinness World Records. At the age of 26 years 329 days, roughly the feline equivalent of 120 human years, the record-breaking pet is in good health, although poorly sighted and deaf. The oldest cat who ever lived was aged 38 years and 3 days.

55.title: Polygraph test reveals Aftab used more than 1 weapon to chop Shraddha's body: Reports
55.article_body: Aftab Poonawala, who underwent a polygraph test on Thursday, used more than one weapon to chop Shraddha Walkar's body, reports said. His body language during the test was normal, reports added. Aftab's narco analysis will be done following his polygraph test which will take place during his judicial custody which ends on Saturday.

56.title: A lot of newcomers have the victim syndrome: Luv Ranjan on nepotism
56.article_body: Filmmaker Luv Ranjan, speaking about nepotism in the film industry, has said that many newcomers have the victim syndrome. "We get stuck up in the notion that I'm good. But it doesn't mean that others are bad. People don't realize that filmmaking cannot be detached from business," he added. Luv stated that nepotism in the industry is a "sour topic".

57.title: Kitchen robotics startup Nosh raises $1 million in pre-seed round
57.article_body: Bengaluru-based robotics startup Nosh, which uses artificial intelligence to ensure food consistency and taste, has raised $1 million in a pre-seed round led by BITS Spark. SuperMorpheus and other angel investors also participated in the funding round. Nosh is an app-driven cooking robot, developed by Euphotic Labs, that cooks an extensive range of dishes automatically.

58.title: Man poses as 'Rajasthani royal' in Mumbai, blackmails 50 women with personal pics
58.article_body: Mumbai Police on Tuesday arrested a 25-year-old man, Pukraj Dewasi alias Rajveer Singh, for allegedly threatening over 50 women to upload their personal photos on social media. According to police, Singh would pose as a royal, post photos of himself inside Rajasthani palaces and befriend women. After befriending women, he would eventually request personal photos, which he used for extortion.

59.title: MNS workers slap Navi Mumbai hotel manager for not playing Marathi songs
59.article_body: Workers of Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) slapped the manager of a hotel in Navi Mumbai after he refused to play Marathi songs in the hotel during a party, reports said. A video purportedly showed the workers arguing with the manager before slapping him. The incident took place in Vashi area.

60.title: Hospital employee in Pune kills wife by injecting lethal drugs, arrested
60.article_body: A 23-year-old male nurse working at a hospital in Pune district was arrested for allegedly killing his wife by administering her lethal injections, police said. The accused, Swapnil Sawant, tried to pass it off as a suicide. Sawant had an affair with a nurse at the hospital and decided to marry her, police said. He wanted to eliminate his wife.

61.title: Nearly ₹400 crore tax deposited through 5 lakh updated ITRs: Official
61.article_body: The government has received ₹400 crore tax after five lakh updated income tax returns (ITRs) were filed, a senior official said. The ITR-U form was made available in May for taxpayers to update their ITRs for fiscal years starting 2019-20. The Budget 2022-23 permitted taxpayers to update their ITRs within two years of filing, subject to payment of taxes.

62.title: Sensex hits all-time high at over 62,300, Nifty tops 18,450
62.article_body: The Sensex on Thursday hit an all-time high of 62,333 after zooming over 800 points. The Nifty50 index was up 225 points at around 18,492. Domestic markets extended gains in Thursday's intra-day trade after minutes from the November meeting revealed that the US Federal Reserve officials expect to switch to smaller interest rate increases "soon".

63.title: 'Ban on non-Hindu shops' posters put up at K'taka's Subramanya temple
63.article_body: Hindu Jagaran Vedike has put up posters at Karnataka's Kukke Subramanya temple, "banning" shops belonging to non-Hindus, reports said. The poster reads, "As the 'Champa Sashti' festival will be celebrated at Kukke Subramanya, the shops and stalls of other communities, except Hindus, are banned around the temple." The festival is slated to begin next week.

64.title: 'Automatic seat cover up' installed in western-style toilets at CSMT
64.article_body: The Central Railway has installed 'automatic seat cover up' arrangement in western-style toilets at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) to ensure better hygiene for passengers. A seat cover will remain in the down position when someone is using the toilet, otherwise it will lift up automatically. The arrangement acts mechanically with the help of springs and other objects.

65.title: Over 500 people fall ill after having food at a wedding in Bihar
65.article_body: Over 500 people fell ill after consuming adulterated food at a wedding in Bihar's Madhepura district. They have been admitted to the JanNayak Karpoori Thakur Medical College and Sadar hospitals. The patients complained of abdominal pain, vomiting, headache and fever a few hours after having the food. Around 2,000 people were invited to the wedding.

66.title: Potential funding interest came in 8 mins after I filed bankruptcy docs: FTX ex-CEO
66.article_body: After the collapse of crypto exchange FTX, its former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried sent an apology letter to its employees. Listing the reasons that led to the company's breakdown, he wrote, "I disappointed all of you...We likely could have raised significant funding; potential interest in billions of dollars of funding came in roughly eight minutes after I signed...Chapter 11 docs."

67.title: B'luru man missing since murder of 2-yr-old daughter arrested after 8 days
67.article_body: An ex-IT sector employee was arrested in Bengaluru in connection with his two-year-old daughter's murder after being on run for eight days. Hours after Rahul Parmar and his daughter Jiya went missing from their residence on November 15, Jiya's body was found in a Kolar lake. Rahul had reportedly lost his job earlier this year and was under financial strain.

68.title: Delhi's Jama Masjid to allow entry for women only if they come with family, husband
68.article_body: Delhi's Jama Masjid on Thursday banned the entry of women who come alone or in groups to the mosque. Married couples and women visiting Jama Masjid with families are, however, exempted from the ban. Issuing a notice to the mosque's Imam, DCW chief Swati Maliwal tweeted, "As much as a man has the right to worship, so does a woman."

69.title: Felt lost after Vicky Donor's success, had to rediscover myself: Yami
69.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam said that right after the success of 'Vicky Donor', she felt "lost" and wasn't able to connect to the opportunities that she was receiving at that time. She said she "had to rediscover" herself and understand her purpose of coming into Bollywood. "It took me a while to understand myself...how to channelise my voice," she added.

70.title: Thane civic body’s tax collection crosses ₹500 crore-mark this year
70.article_body: The Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) on Wednesday crossed the ₹500 crore-mark in tax collection this financial year so far, a civic official said. The tax collection so far this year has been ₹502.12 crore and the maximum collection of ₹173.98 crore came from the Majiwada-Manpada ward, Municipal Commissioner Abhijit Bangar said.

71.title: Tried to play safe with Raksha Bandhan, failed miserably: Aanand L Rai
71.article_body: Filmmaker Aanand L Rai said he "played safe" with 'Raksha Bandhan', which is why it "failed miserably". "There were some expectations...I was unable to deliver," Aanand shared. He said that his "biggest mistake" while making the film was "differentiating" between the audiences. "I thought...let me cater to audience in the B and C tier cities...that's not my job," he concluded.

72.title: K-pop band BTS' member Jin to begin military service on Dec 13: Report
72.article_body: K-pop band BTS' oldest member Jin will begin his mandatory military service on December 13, South Korean newspaper reported citing military authorities. Jin, who will turn 30 on December 4, will receive five weeks of training at a bootcamp before being deployed to a unit. The seven-member band planned to pursue individual projects and reunite in 2025 after finishing service.

73.title: Girlfriend dumps body of man in B'luru after he dies of epileptic attack during sex
73.article_body: A probe into the death of a 67-year-old man, whose body was found in Bengaluru on November 17, has revealed that he died of an epileptic attack while having sex with his girlfriend. The 35-year-old woman, along with her relatives, dumped the body at an isolated spot, as she didn't want anyone to know about her relationship with the deceased.

74.title: Bangalore Literature Festival to be organised on December 3, 4
74.article_body: The 11th edition of the Bangalore Literature Festival (BLF) will be organised on the lawns of the Lalit Ashok Hotel on Kumara Krupa road on December 3, 4 after a gap of two COVID-19 impacted years. This year's edition will feature more than 250 international, Indian, and city authors and speakers, four programme forums and two children's venues, reports said.

75.title: 6 including woman beat history-sheeter to death in Pune; 3 arrested
75.article_body: Six people, including a woman allegedly attacked a history-sheeter with a sickle and beat him to death in Pune's Nana Peth. A senior police inspector said that three of the accused have been arrested while a search is underway to catch the other three. "Prima facie, the murder is the outcome of an old rivalry," the senior police inspector added.

76.title: When sh**ty things happen, we tend to take irrational decisions: FTX ex-CEO
76.article_body: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried sent an apology letter to the employees of the bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange. He wrote, "I feel deeply sorry about what happened…I froze up in the face of pressure and leaks and the Binance LOI and said nothing...Nothing that happened was your fault….When sh**ty things happen to us, we all tend to make irrational decisions."

77.title: I've my eye on Shraddha murder case, killer will get strictest punishment: Amit Shah
77.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said that Delhi Police will ensure that Shraddha Walkar's killer will get the strictest punishment at the earliest, adding, "I've my eye on the matter." "Shraddha had sent a letter to Maharashtra Police saying that she would be killed and cut into pieces. Even after that, no action was taken," he added.

78.title: Pope compares war in Ukraine to 1930s famine caused by Stalin
78.article_body: Pope Francis compared Russian war in Ukraine to the "terrible genocide" of the 1930s, saying that "the extermination by famine was...caused by Stalin". During his address at St Peter's Square in Vatican City, Pope Francis mentioned "Holodomor", or death by starvation and said that Ukrainians were suffering today from "martyrdom of aggression". "Let's pray for victims of...genocide," he added.

79.title: 'Rats ate 580 kg of weed', says UP's Mathura Police; court demands proof
79.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Mathura Police submitted a report to a special Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act (1985) court, claiming that rats "ate" over 580 kg of confiscated weed stored in warehouses. Following the police report, the court asked the police to get rid of the "mice menace" and deliver proof that the rats actually ate the weed worth ₹60 lakh.

80.title: Uber, 2 delivery apps propose offering Mexico drivers social security
80.article_body: Uber and delivery apps DiDi and Rappi on Wednesday said they're open to offering Mexico drivers and couriers social security benefits. According to their statement, those who work an average of over 40 hours a week on one or more platforms can be eligible for the benefits. This comes ahead of a bill in Mexico that will regulate gig economy.

81.title: Muslim students beaten in Guj over 'love jihad' allegations, video surfaces
81.article_body: A group of men, reportedly belonging to Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP), assaulted three Muslim college students in Gujarat on Wednesday over 'love jihad' allegations. A two-minute video of the incident has gone viral on the internet, showing a group of men wearing handkerchiefs as masks as they assault the three students.

82.title: Nations far away from US may see improvement in Twitter's speed: Musk
82.article_body: Days after saying that Twitter is "very slow" in India and many other countries, CEO Elon Musk said on Thursday there could be improvements to Twitter's speed. "You might notice small...major improvements in speed of Twitter...Will be especially significant in countries far away from USA," posted Musk. "Sometimes, it doesn't work at all, especially on Android phones," he had said.

83.title: Traffic movement to remain affected on Delhi's Ring Road for nearly 11 months
83.article_body: Traffic movement on Delhi's Ring Road in both the carriageways from Rajouri Garden towards Punjabi Bagh and vice-versa will remain affected for nearly 11 months, the Delhi Traffic Police said in an advisory. The traffic will remain hit due to the construction of an elevated road from New Moti Nagar flyover to ESI Hospital, the police informed on Thursday.

84.title: Amazon to shut down its online learning platform in India from Aug 2023
84.article_body: Amazon will be shutting down its online learning vertical, Amazon Academy, in India starting August 2023. The company said it will refund the full fee to those enrolled in the current batch and customers will have access to course material until October 2024. While Amazon didn't specify a reason, a report said this is a part of Amazon's cost-cutting measures.

85.title: TMC writes to poll body over 'foreigners' campaigning for BJP in Gujarat
85.article_body: TMC National Spokesperson Saket Gokhale wrote to ECI demanding urgent action in connection with alleged involvement of "foreigners" in election campaigning for BJP in Gujarat. This came after BJP Gujarat tweeted a video. "Foreigners being used by BJP...in complete violation of election laws. Also, foreigners sound Russian, raising serious questions of interference in elections," Gokhale tweeted.

86.title: Inadequate: HC on compensation to Morbi tragedy victims' families
86.article_body: Gujarat High Court has criticised the state government over the compensation given to families of the people who died in the Morbi bridge collapse tragedy, calling it "inadequate and unrealistic". "The compensation paid to critically injured is also not enough," it added. Moreover, the court ordered the Gujarat government to conduct a survey of all bridges in the state.

87.title: Give extra measles vaccine dose to kids in vulnerable areas: Centre
87.article_body: The Centre has asked states and Union Territories to administer an additional dose of measles and rubella vaccines to children aged nine months to five years in vulnerable areas. This comes amid a rise in measles cases in some states, including Maharashtra and Bihar. The states have been asked to earmark wards and beds for effective management of measles cases.

88.title: Paytm's 75% stock decline is world's worst in 10 years among large IPOs
88.article_body: Paytm's parent company One 97 Communications has seen its shares decline 75% from its listing price. Since 2012, this drop is the steepest first-year slide globally among IPOs that raised at least the same amount, as per Bloomberg. On November 23, Paytm shares hit an all-time low of ₹440, falling below the previous low of ₹511 on May 12.

89.title: B'luru man, who turned woman, to get gender-corrected passport: Report
89.article_body: The Regional Passport Office (RPO) in Bengaluru received a gender change request on a passport after a resident underwent sex-change surgery to become a woman. This is reportedly the first time that a passport is being rectified for gender change after a surgical procedure since the process became digitised. The woman's new passport will be issued after police verification.

90.title: Unknown Islamist group claims responsibility for Mangaluru blast, probe begins
90.article_body: The police have launched an investigation after an unknown Islamist group, Islamic Resistance Council, claimed responsibility for the Mangaluru autorickshaw blast in a statement, reports said. According to the group's statement, the target was a temple in Kadri but the bomb exploded before reaching there. The group also threatened Karnataka ADGP (Law and Order) Alok Kumar in the statement.

91.title: We held on due to lessons learnt by our players in Germany: Japan coach
91.article_body: Reacting to 24th-ranked Japan defeating four-time champions Germany 2-1 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener, Japan's manager Hajime Moriyasu said, "[In] the end, they came at us with...full power." "In the past, maybe we would have lost, but the players have been playing in Germany...They have learned so much from that, so we held on," added Moriyasu.

92.title: Game of Thrones actor Wilko Johnson passes away aged 75
92.article_body: Wilko Johnson, who portrayed mute executioner Ilyn Payne in Game of Thrones, has passed away at the age of 75. A guitarist for 1970s pub-rock band Dr Feelgood, Johnson passed away at home on Monday. Johnson, who was born in Canvey Island, Essex, was diagnosed with late stage pancreatic cancer in early 2013.

93.title: Vladimir Putin can no longer win war in Ukraine: German Chancellor
93.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "can no longer win on the battlefield". During a joint press conference in Berlin, Scholz called for an immediate end to Russia's "bombing terror against the civilian population". "My appeal to Putin remains: stop senseless killing, withdraw your troops completely from Ukraine and agree to peace talks," Scholz added.

94.title: Glenmark Pharma's Goa unit receives US regulator's warning letter
94.article_body: The United States Food & Drug Administration (USFDA) has issued a warning letter to Glenmark Pharmaceuticals' manufacturing facility in Goa. USFDA inspected the Goa facility in May 2022 and issued Official Action Indicated. The drug maker believes that the warning letter will not have an impact on the "disruption of supplies or the existing revenue from operations of this facility".

95.title: Govt to bring law to regulate digital media: Union Minister Anurag Thakur
95.article_body: Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur has said that the Centre is working on a bill to regulate digital media. He said communication of news has become multidimensional with the development of electronic and digital media. "It presents opportunities as well as challenges. To have a fine balance, the government will see what can be done on this," he said.

96.title: Brazilian court rejects Bolsonaro's election challenge, imposes $4.27 mn fine
96.article_body: A court in Brazil has rejected outgoing President Jair Bolsonaro's demand to annul votes cast on most of the nation's electronic voting machines, imposing a $4.27 million fine on his coalition for "bad faith" litigation. The court called Bolsonaro's request "bizarre" and "illicit", adding that the challenge appeared to be a ploy to encourage more anti-democratic protests in the country.

97.title: Auditioned for 'The Amazing Spider-Man', Andrew Garfield got it: Joe
97.article_body: Singer-actor Joe Jonas revealed that he had auditioned for 'The Amazing Spider-Man' but he didn't get it. He said he was "excited" about the part but when he didn't get it, in that moment, he felt "destroyed" and "defeated". The 2012 film featured Andrew Garfield in the lead role of Spider-Man. "Obviously, he was the right one," Joe said.

98.title: Pant is becoming a liability, bring in Sanju Samson: Reetinder Sodhi
98.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi said Rishabh Pant is becoming a "liability" for India, adding that it's time to provide an opportunity to Sanju Samson. "You got to take that chance because you cannot afford to lose...in...ICC tournaments. When you give too many chances, problems arise," added Reetinder. "If he's not performing, you've...to show him the exit door," he stated.

99.title: Amazon plans to invest $1 bn a year to make movies for theatres: Report
99.article_body: Amazon is planning to invest more than $1 billion a year to make movies for theatres, Bloomberg reported. The company aims to produce between 12 and 15 films annually for theatrical release, the report added. The world's largest e-commerce firm will reportedly release a small number of movies in cinemas next year and increase its output over time.

100.title: We hear people's 'Mann Ki Baat' for 8 hrs unlike PM: Rahul Gandhi
100.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said that his party listened to people's 'Mann Ki Baat' for eight hours during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and spoke for 15 minutes, unlike PM Narendra Modi's monthly radio programme in which he addresses nation for 30 minutes. "We listen to what is on the mind of farmers, youth, women, labourers and small-scale traders," he added.

101.title: Vizhinjam port may miss Dec 2023 deadline due to protests: Adani Group
101.article_body: Kerala government's ₹7,500-crore Vizhinjam Seaport, being developed by the Adani Group, is facing protests by the locals. Adani Group said if the protests continue, their December 2023 deadline might get extended. The protesters allege that the project will adversely affect the fishermen's livelihoods, the coastal ecosystem and the ecology of the Western Ghats due to the mining of granite stones.

102.title: Vijay fined ₹500 for flouting tinted glass norms: Report
102.article_body: Tamil actor Vijay has reportedly been fined ₹500 by the Chennai Traffic Police for flouting the tinted glass norms. As per a report, the actor was penalised for this violation after he met his fans at the fan club Vijay Makkal Iyakkam's office in Chennai on Monday. On the work front, Vijay will be seen in Vamshi Paidipally's 'Varisu'.

103.title: One who wants to serve country won't want to be Agniveer: Akhilesh
103.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said that one who wants to serve the country will never want to become Agniveer. "The government is saying that it is saving the budget through these schemes, but when the country itself will not survive, how can the budget survive," Yadav added. He was addressing an ex-servicemen conference in poll-bound Mainpuri.

104.title: Why didn't police take any action?: DCW chief on Shraddha’s complaint in 2020
104.article_body: After a complaint surfaced which was filed by Shraddha Walkar in 2020 against Aftab Poonawala, who allegedly murdered her, Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal asked, "Why no action was taken by the police?" "As long as the systems of the country will remain so hollow, girls will keep dying like this," she tweeted.

105.title: 2 MP men arrested for carrying marijuana worth ₹2 lakh in Pune
105.article_body: Two men from Madhya Pradesh have been arrested for allegedly carrying marijuana worth ₹2.06 lakh in Pune. Acting on a tip, the police recovered 10.31 kg of marijuana from the bags the suspects were carrying on their shoulders in Yerwada on Wednesday. They also seized cell phones of the suspects. A case under the NDPS Act has been registered.

106.title: Railways fired 1 'non-performer' every 3 days since July 2021: Officials
106.article_body: Indian Railways has fired one "non-performer or corrupt official" every three days since July 2021, officials said. They said while 139 officers were forced to take voluntary retirement, 38 others were removed from service. After Ashwini Vaishnaw took office as Railways Minister in July 2021, he warned officials "to take VRS and sit at home" if they did not perform.

107.title: Drinking water supply to be disrupted in parts of Hyderabad on Nov 26
107.article_body: Some parts of Hyderabad will face drinking water supply disruption on November 26 for 24 hours, starting from 6 am. The areas to be affected include Balapur, Lenin Nagar, Bandangpet, Budvel, Shamshabad and Almasguda. The disruption will be witnessed due to work that will be undertaken to address the water supply leakage at Shivaji Chowk and Balapur.

108.title: 2 IEDs recovered from suspected drone-dropped package in J&K
108.article_body: Two IEDs, a detonator, two Chinese pistols, ₹5 lakh cash, etc, have been recovered from a package that is suspected to have been dropped by a drone in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba on Thursday, according to the SSP. The items could have been used for "any untoward incident", the SSP said. Earlier, BSF had killed a Pakistani intruder in Jammu.

109.title: Richa Chadha apologises for insulting tweet on Indian Army, says 'I know how it feels'
109.article_body: Richa Chadha has deleted her insulting tweet on the Indian Army and apologised. She wrote, "A whole family is affected when their son is martyred or even injured...I personally know how it feels." She had tweeted, "Galwan says hi", while reacting to Northern Army Commander Lt General Upendra Dwivedi's statement that the Army is ready to take back Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

110.title: He's critical, has multiple organ failure: Vikram Gokhale's wife
110.article_body: Actor Vikram Gokhale's wife Vrushali Gokhale has shared that the actor is "critical since the last 24 hours" and has "multiple organ failure". "Doctors are trying their best. He's not responding to the treatment as expected," she said. Earlier, his daughter Neha Gokhale said that the actor is "on life support" and asked his well-wishers to "keep praying for him".

111.title: Former ISI chief Lt General Syed Asim Munir appointed Pakistan's new army chief
111.article_body: Pakistan Federal Minister for Information & Broadcasting, Marriyum Aurangzeb, on Thursday announced that Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has appointed Lt General Syed Asim Munir as the country's new army chief. She also announced that Lt General Sahir Shamshad Mirza has been appointed as Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. Munir has served as Director-General of ISI in the past.

112.title: IT couple robbed at Parvati tekdi in Pune, 2 suspects arrested
112.article_body: A couple, working as IT professionals, were allegedly robbed of their gold chain, mobiles, wristwatch and cash at Parvati tekdi in Pune on Tuesday. The suspects stopped the couple and demanded valuables from them. When the victims refused, one of the suspects hit the man on his head with a sickle, injuring him. The police identified and arrested two suspects.

113.title: Video of 'Earth Rise' as seen from Moon goes viral
113.article_body: NASA has shared a video of "Earth Rise" as seen from the Moon. The footage was taken by Artemis 1 mission's unmanned Orion spacecraft. The Artemis 1, which was launched from Kennedy Space Center on November 16 after two failed attempts, is a critical part of NASA's Moon to Mars exploration approach.

114.title: SC questions the speed of CEC Arun Goel's appointment, govt asks SC to 'hold your mouth'
114.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday questioned the "lightning speed" at which Chief Election Commissioner Arun Goel's name was finalised after the Centre placed the original file of his appointment before the constitution bench. The Centre through Attorney General R Venkataramani said, "Please hold your mouth for a while. I request to look into the issue in entirety."

115.title: I make sure I keep up with Team India or I'll be left behind: Dhawan
115.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan said he ensures that he keeps up with the pace of Team India as he's aware that he will be "left behind" otherwise. "I make sure that I keep myself in that groove," added Dhawan. "Having played for so many years...I handle pressure with...ease...It's about being positive [mentally] because life puts everybody down on their knees," he stated.

116.title: Fadnavis' statement on border issue provocative: Karnataka CM
116.article_body: Reacting to Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis' statement on Karnataka-Maharashtra border issue, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that his statement is "provocative". "His dream will never come true. Our government is committed to protecting the country's land, water and borders," Bommai added. The reaction came after Fadnavis said that no village from Maharashtra will go anywhere.

117.title: I've great respect for Twitter staff working late into night: Musk
117.article_body: Appreciating the team working at Twitter, CEO Elon Musk said, "To be fair, there are many people at Twitter working late into the night, for whom I have great respect." He was responding to a tweet by a user, who said, "I heard you're working on a new banger book with Tim Ferris. 'The 40 hour work week'."

118.title: Tata Consumer stock rises by 2% after Bisleri stake sale talks
118.article_body: The stock of Tata Consumer Products Limited surged by over 2% on Thursday after Bisleri International Chairman Ramesh Chauhan reportedly said that he is in talks with the Tata Group firm to divest some of his stake. The deal is reportedly worth ₹6,000-7,000 crore. At 12:08 pm, Tata Consumer Products' stock was trading 1.90% higher at ₹784.80/share on the NSE.

119.title: Foxconn offers ₹1 lakh to new hires to leave China factory after violent clashes
119.article_body: After the violent clashes at the world's largest iPhone factory in China, Foxconn has started offering 10,000 yuan (around ₹1 lakh) to any new recruits who want to resign and leave the campus. Workers at the company protested against overdue pay and strict COVID-19 restrictions, following which Foxconn issued an apology and said there was a "technical error" during recruitment.

120.title: Delhi child rights body writes to NCERT over story 'perpetuating patriarchy'
120.article_body: Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights (DCPCR) Chairman Anurag Kundu has written a letter to NCERT over a chapter titled 'This Little Girl' in Class IX English textbook which "normalises violent masculinity, perpetuates patriarchy and promotes toxic behaviour in...family". He requested that the story should be modified or replaced from the textbook for the next academic session onwards.

121.title: Teenager, senior citizen among 6 people killed in Walmart shooting in US
121.article_body: A 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old man have been identified as the youngest and the oldest victims of mass shooting at a Walmart store in the US state of Virginia. The oldest victim's cousin wrote on Facebook that he had worked at Walmart for many years and planned to retire next year. Police has not revealed details of minor victim.

122.title: Balika Vadhu actress Neha Marda announces pregnancy; shares pic
122.article_body: Actor Neha Marda has announced that she and her husband, Ayushman Agrawal, will soon become parents. She shared a photo with her husband and wrote, "Finally god has arrived in me...baby coming soon 2023." Neha, who married Ayushman in 2012, has acted in shows like Balika Vadhu, Doli Armaano Ki and Kyun Rishton Mein Katti Batti.

123.title: Couple with the world record of having the most body modifications have 98 mods now
123.article_body: The married couple Gabriela Peralta (Argentina) and Victor Hugo Peralta (Uruguay), who first set the Guinness World Record in 2014 with 84 body modifications, have a total of 98 modifications now. Together, they have 50 piercings, 14 body implants, five dental implants, four ear expanders and a forked tongue. The couple has been dubbed the "cherubs from hell".

124.title: Captaincy comes & goes, we come into the world empty-handed & leave empty-handed: Dhawan
124.article_body: On being asked whether he'd be conscious of "needing to improve" his strike-rate as PBKS captain, given he lost his captaincy at SRH as it affected his batting, Shikhar Dhawan said, "Jobs come and go...no worries." He added, "We come into the world empty-handed and leave empty-handed. All this just remains here...I don't feel any fear about losing the job."

125.title: If 'Gopi Kishan' gets remade, want only Ahan to do it: Suniel Shetty
125.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said that if his film 'Gopi Kishan' is ever remade, he would want his son Ahan Shetty to star in it. "I wouldn't want anyone else to do it. I think Ahan will do a great job," he shared. "With 'Gopi Kishan', I had an opportunity to showcase my talent...and also comic timing," the actor added.

126.title: Japan football team cleans up locker room after win over Germany; pic goes viral
126.article_body: After 24th ranked Japan defeated four time champions Germany in 2022 FIFA World Cup, the team cleaned up the locker room. FIFA's official Twitter account shared a picture and wrote, "After [a] historic victory...Japan fans cleaned up their rubbish in the stadium, whilst the team left their changing room at Khalifa International Stadium like this. Spotless."

127.title: The least they deserve is respect: Nadal on reaction to Argentina's loss
127.article_body: Talking about the reaction to Argentina's 1-2 loss against Saudi Arabia in their recent 2022 FIFA World Cup Group C match, Rafael Nadal said, "The least they deserve is...respect." "The world hasn't changed. They simply lost a game," added Nadal. Discussing his team's morale after the loss against Saudi Arabia, Argentina captain Lionel Messi had termed it as "dead".

128.title: Man sets house of neighbour on fire in Greater Noida following argument
128.article_body: A man had allegedly set the house of his neighbour on fire in Greater Noida after an argument broke out between them when he went to purchase clothes from her. The woman asked the man to leave, following which the man set the pile of clothes on fire which spread rapidly into the house. The woman had a narrow escape.

129.title: Kamal Haasan discharged from hospital, advised two days rest
129.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan's team has shared that the actor has been discharged from the hospital in Chennai and has been advised to take rest for two days. The actor was admitted to the hospital after complaining of uneasiness and fever. Kamal Haasan is currently busy with the shooting of his upcoming film 'Indian 2', which is being directed by Shankar.

130.title: Ludhiana RTO fined for giving same registration number for 2 vehicles
130.article_body: The Ludhiana District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission ordered a Regional Transport Office (RTO) to pay ₹7,500 to a man for issuing the same registration number for two vehicles. The complainant said he bought a vehicle from Delhi and applied for a new registration number in Ludhiana RTO. He later found out the same number was allotted to another person.

131.title: Don't know why I got this: De Bruyne on being named Player of the Match
131.article_body: Reacting to being named Player of the Match in Belgium's 2022 FIFA World Cup opener against Canada, midfielder Kevin De Bruyne said, "I...[didn't play] a great game. I don't know why I got the trophy." "We didn't build up well...It wasn't good enough...We made it difficult for ourselves and that caused stress," he added. De Bruyne represents Manchester City.

132.title: Priyanka joins Rahul Gandhi for Bharat Jodo Yatra in Madhya Pradesh
132.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Thursday joined her brother and party leader Rahul Gandhi in Madhya Pradesh for the Bharat Jodo Yatra. The Congress party tweeted a picture of the two, saying, "The steps will be strong when we walk together." This is the first time that Priyanka was seen being part of the Bharat Jodo Yatra.

133.title: Delhi's India Gate lawns to be temporarily shut amid heavy footfall
133.article_body: The lawns at Delhi's India Gate are being closed temporarily in sections to "give the grass a breather" amid heavy footfall, Central Public Works Department (CPWD) officials said. An official said that the CPWD is cordoning off sections for 15 days at a time. This intervention is only required on the two sections nearest to India Gate, the official added.

134.title: Hero Vired & INSEAD collaboratively launch a Product Management program
134.article_body: Hero Vired, Hero Group's EdTech company and INSEAD have collaboratively designed a new program on Data-Driven Product Management. The program equips students with a 360-degree understanding of product management including product development. The program includes placement assurance, masterclasses, workshops with industry experts and live sessions with the INSEAD faculty, Hero Vired stated.

135.title: Milma to increase price of milk by ₹6 from December 1 in Kerala
135.article_body: Milma has decided to increase the price of milk by ₹6 from December 1, Kerala Co-operative Milk Marketing Federation (KCMMF) Chairman KS Mani said on Wednesday. He added that ₹5.025 of the total hike will go to the farmers. The present hike will benefit the milk producers and entice more of them to join the dairy sector, he further said.

136.title: Over 40 people injured during firecracker show in Odisha
136.article_body: Over 40 people reportedly suffered burn injuries during a firecracker show at the immersion venue at Balia Bazaar in Odisha's Kendrapara town on Wednesday. "The mishap occurred when sparks from a cracker fell on a firecracker stock triggering a chain of explosion injuring all the people standing nearby," said an official. At least four victims were reported to be critical.

137.title: Only 1 team having a laugh now: Hamann on Rüdiger mocking Japan's Asano
137.article_body: Ex-Germany midfielder Didi Hamann termed Germany defender Antonio Rüdiger's decision to mock Japanese player Takuma Asano's running style during their recent 2022 FIFA World Cup match as "very unprofessional". "You don't belittle the opposition like that...He was having a laugh, there's only one team having a laugh now...I've got no explanation...for it," said Hamann. Japan recorded a 2-1 win.

138.title: BMC to take decision on Gokhale bridge reopening in 7 days
138.article_body: The decision to reopen the Gokhale bridge in Andheri, which is shut since November 7, is likely to come in next seven days. The BMC will take decision after going through the reports of Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute (VJTI) and Indian Institute of Technology Bombay (IIT-B) which opined that it could be reopened for pedestrians and light motor vehicles (LMVs).

139.title: Measles poses imminent global threat due to pandemic: WHO & CDC
139.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) and the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) have issued a joint report declaring measles an imminent threat globally as the pandemic weakened surveillance of the disease. A record high of nearly 40 million children missed a measles vaccine dose in 2021 due to hurdles created by the pandemic, the report mentioned.

140.title: Samantha is not hospitalised, she is resting at home: Actress' spokesperson
140.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu's spokesperson has dismissed the reports that she has been hospitalised in Hyderabad. Reports claimed that Samantha, who was diagnosed with myositis this year, was admitted to a hospital after her health deteriorated on Wednesday. Her spokesperson told IndiaToday.in that Samantha is not hospitalised but is at home and resting.

141.title: Actress Richa Chadha criticised for insulting tweet on Indian Army
141.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha has been criticised for an insulting tweet on the Indian Army. While reacting to the statement of Northern Army Commander Lt General Upendra Dwivedi that the Indian Army is ready to execute orders like taking back Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, she tweeted, "Galwan says hi." Twenty Indian soldiers were martyred in the Galwan clash.

142.title: Cover grey hair, no crew cut for males: Air India in new grooming rules for cabin crew
142.article_body: Air India has issued a new set of grooming guidelines for its cabin crew. Female crew members have been asked not to wear pearl earrings, only one bangle without design and no high top knots. The male crew members have been asked not to sport crew cuts. They have been asked to cover grey hair regularly in a natural shade.

143.title: Zetwerk-backer Kae Capital marks final close of 3rd fund at ₹767 cr
143.article_body: Venture capital firm Kae Capital has marked the final close of its third fund at ₹767 crore ($100 million). Through the fund, Kae Capital will invest in pre-Seed to pre-Series rounds. International and domestic institutional investors, family offices and startup founders participated in the fund. Kae Capital claims to be the first institutional investor in Tata 1MG and Zetwerk.

144.title: 6 lose vision in one eye after cataract surgery at UP hospital; FIR filed
144.article_body: Six villagers, aged between 55 and 78, have allegedly lost vision in one eye after undergoing cataract surgery at a private hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. An FIR has been filed against the eye surgeon and a local resident following a preliminary probe into the matter. Kanpur Chief Medical Officer told Indian Express that the hospital's licence was also revoked.

145.title: China sees highest daily COVID cases since start of pandemic as 31,444 test positive
145.article_body: China on Wednesday reported the highest number of daily COVID-19 cases since the start of the pandemic, according to official data. The number of new local cases was 31,444 on November 23, of which 3,927 were symptomatic and 27,517 were asymptomatic. The number broke the previous record set on April 13, when local cases hit 29,317.

146.title: Man steals luxury car to impress girlfriend in Pune, arrested
146.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested by Samarth police in Pune on the charges of stealing a luxury car allegedly to impress his girlfriend. According to the complainant, who deals in sales and purchase of luxury cars, accused Ishant Sharma borrowed a car from the showroom to show it off to his mother and girlfriend. Later, he escaped with the car.

147.title: Foxconn apologises for 'technical error' in hiring at China plant after clashes erupt
147.article_body: After violent protests broke out at the world's largest iPhone factory in China, Foxconn on Thursday said that a "technical error" occurred when hiring new recruits and apologised for it. While some workers complained they were forced to share dormitories with COVID-19-positive staff, others protested about overdue pay and COVID-19 restrictions. Several videos of the clashes also surfaced online.

148.title: My father, Messi can't be compared, they're different planets: Maradona's son
148.article_body: Late Argentine football legend Diego Maradona's son Diego Sinagra said comparisons between his father and Lionel Messi are made by those who "don't see and understand" football. "We are talking about two different planets," added Sinagra. Discussing Argentina's 1-2 loss against Saudi Arabia in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener, Sinagra stated, "I am devastated...They were quite scared."

149.title: Musk tweets ‘#Stay@Work’ t-shirt after finding ‘#StayWoke’ t-shirts at Twitter
149.article_body: After finding a closet full of t-shirts with '#StayWoke' written on them at Twitter's headquarters, CEO Elon Musk tweeted a photo of a black t-shirt with "#Stay@Work" printed on it. "Awesome new Twitter merch!" Musk captioned the photo. This comes amid reports of mass resignations following Musk's ultimatum to commit to an "extremely hardcore" culture at Twitter or leave.

150.title: 233 measles cases, 12 deaths in Mumbai, nearby areas this year
150.article_body: Mumbai and nearby areas have reported 233 cases of measles so far this year, according to data released by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). As many as 12 patients have died, the latest victim being an eight-month-old boy from Bhiwandi. The baby, who was partially immunised, developed symptoms of measles and was put on life support, but he didn't survive.

151.title: Healthtech startup RedBrick AI raises $4.6 mn from Sequoia India, Surge
151.article_body: US-headquartered healthtech startup, RedBrick AI, has secured $4.6 million in a seed funding round led by Sequoia India and Southeast Asia's Surge. The funding round also saw participation from Y Combinator and angel investors. RedBrick AI was co-founded by University of Michigan alumni Shivam Sharma and Derek Lukacs, both having previously worked on SpaceX’s Hyperloop technology.

152.title: UG students get a hostel for the first time in 135 yrs of Hyd's Nizam College
152.article_body: After over 20 days of silent protest by about 300 girls of Hyderabad's Nizam College demanding a hostel for girls, the government approved their demand. The government decided to allocate a newly built, 76-room hostel building for 400 undergraduate girls - a first in the 135-year-old history of the college. UG girls were the only group without hostel accommodation.

153.title: UP to observe holiday on Nov 28 to mark Guru Tegh Bahadur Shaheedi Diwas
153.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has announced a holiday on November 28 to mark the occasion of Guru Tegh Bahadur Shaheedi Diwas. Guru Tegh Bahadur, who is the ninth Sikh Guru, was born in Amritsar in 1621 and was martyred under the rule of the Mughal emperor Aurangzeb in 1675. Guru Tegh Bahadur is also popularly known as 'Hind di Chaddar'.

154.title: Remove encroachment on Senapati Bapat Marg in a month: HC to BMC
154.article_body: The Bombay High Court has ordered BMC's G North ward to clear illegal encroachment from the Senapati Bapat Marg in a month or face action. The encroachment in the Mahim area causes traffic snarls and difficulties for pedestrians. Four Mahim residents, who moved the HC against this, said that despite multiple requests to BMC, no permanent steps have been taken.

155.title: Kamal Haasan hospitalised in Chennai after complaining of uneasiness and fever: Reports
155.article_body: Kamal Haasan has reportedly been admitted to Sri Ramachandra Medical Centre (SRMC) hospital in Chennai, after complaining of uneasiness and fever. The 68-year-old actor, who was in Hyderabad a few days ago, was advised by doctors to rest. He is likely to get discharged on Thursday.

156.title: Everything I do or have done right is because of Priyanka: Nick
156.article_body: Singer-actor Nick Jonas said that everything he does or has done right is because of Priyanka Chopra. Describing his relationship with Priyanka, Nick said that the two have a connection where they discuss their decisions on business, emotional and creative matters and even voice their opinions to each other. He said that all such conversations with Priyanka have been "invaluable".

157.title: No bigger proof of govt's 'inefficiency' than change of CMs in Guj: Cong MP
157.article_body: There can’t be a bigger proof of a government’s "inefficiency" than the move to change its CMs in BJP-ruled Gujarat, Congress MP Manish Tewari said. "What will be the plight of (current CM) is for public to decide. There cannot be a bigger living example of governance failure than the fact that you've to change your CMs thrice," Tewari added.

158.title: This was the most important game: Neuer after Germany's loss vs Japan
158.article_body: Germany captain Manuel Neuer said he's "totally frustrated" with the manner in which his team "gave up" during their 1-2 loss against Japan in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener. "We're under pressure...This was the most important game," added Neuer. "The imperative that we wanted to score the second goal was...missing...We brought Japan back into the game," he stated.

159.title: Even if I die, continue peaceful protests: Farmer leader on fast to followers
159.article_body: Bharti Kisan Union (Ekta Sidhupur) President Jagjit Singh Dallewal, whose fast entered its fifth day on Wednesday, said, "Even if I die, I appeal to farmer colleagues to carry out their protests in a peaceful manner." Dallewal has pledged to fast unto death till the Punjab government agrees to various demands of the farmers.

160.title: Tata Consumer to acquire Bisleri for about ₹7,000 crore: Report
160.article_body: Ramesh Chauhan is divesting Bisleri International to Tata Consumer Products Limited for about ₹6,000-7,000 crore, as per a report. The report added that Chauhan doesn't have a successor to take Bisleri to the next level of expansion. Chauhan reportedly called it a "painful" decision and said that The Tata Group "will nurture and take care of it even better."

161.title: German officials learn cricket from Indian colleagues at Consulate General; video viral
161.article_body: German Consul in Bengaluru, Achim Burkart, took to Twitter to share a video and wrote, "During lunch break my Indian colleagues try to teach my German colleagues how to play cricket." "Happy to report that the consulate is still intact," he added. The video shared by Burkart went viral on social media.

162.title: Nirav Modi seeks permission to appeal extradition in UK Supreme Court
162.article_body: Fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi filed an application in the High Court in London, seeking permission to appeal against his extradition order in UK Supreme Court. He is currently behind bars at London's Wandsworth prison. The court had rejected his appeal earlier this month while ordering his extradition to India to face charges in the ₹14,000-crore Punjab National Bank scam case.

163.title: Over 43,000 people fined for not wearing seat belts in Mumbai
163.article_body: At least 43,689 drivers and passengers have been fined by Mumbai Traffic Police for not wearing seat belts, including both front and rear, since November 1. According to official data, 22,970 challans were issued to drivers and 20,719 to passengers. Wearing rear seat belts has been made mandatory since November 10.

164.title: Bombay HC denies divorce to Pune man who lied about wife being HIV+
164.article_body: The Bombay High Court rejected the divorce petition of a 44-year-old Pune resident who falsely claimed that his wife was HIV positive and sought divorce on that ground. The man claimed that his wife while undergoing treatment for "herpes" in 2004 tested positive for HIV. However, the man failed to submit any proof to the court to substantiate his claim.

165.title: 'Should Twitter offer a general amnesty to suspended accounts?' Musk launches new poll
165.article_body: Days after reinstating several banned Twitter accounts, Elon Musk on Wednesday held another poll on whether the site should offer a "general amnesty" to suspended accounts, provided the users have not broken the law. Earlier, Musk ran a similar poll asking Twitter users if former US President Donald Trump's account should be reinstated, following which 51.8% voted yes.

166.title: Scindia to inaugurate airport multilevel parking tomorrow: Pune MP
166.article_body: Pune MP Girish Bapat has said that Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia will inaugurate the multilevel parking at the airport in the city tomorrow. "The parking lot will also provide other facilities to passengers," he added. Earlier, Airports Authority of India said that Indian Air Force has approved over 200 slots daily for civil flight operations for Pune airport.

167.title: Comedy movies never get their due, it's not easy: Kiara Advani
167.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani said that doing comedy on screen looks easy but it's "very difficult" for the actors to perform. "It (comedy movies) never gets its due but it's not easy," she expressed. Director Shashank Khaitan said, "Comedy is the toughest to do...it's the toughest to write, act and direct." Kiara's next film is Shashank's upcoming directorial 'Govinda Naam Mera'.

168.title: Man's flight ticket shows 2 destinations and departures, social media users react
168.article_body: A passenger named Auditya Venkatesh was booking an AirAsia flight ticket from Hyderabad to Bengaluru when his arrival and departure were mixed up in the confirmation popup, showing he was booking ticket from Hyderabad to Bengaluru as well as from Bengaluru to Kolkata. While AirAsia said it was a "glitch", a Twitter user wrote, "Bro's travelling in the multiverse now."

169.title: Pic of Senegal's football team coach goes viral for his resemblance to Snoop Dogg
169.article_body: A picture of Senegal football coach Aliou Cisse is going viral on social media as several users pointed out that he looks like American rapper Snoop Dogg. The rapper reacted to the picture of Cisse with a football emoticon. "Why is Snoop Dogg the coach of Senegal?" read a tweet posted by a user.

170.title: Housing projects issued notices seeking ₹14,184 cr dues in Gr Noida
170.article_body: Greater Noida Authority has issued notices to 143 housing projects in the city seeking recovery of ₹14,184 crore dues. "If...realtors fail to pay their respective dues, we'll have to cancel their allotment according to the terms of the lease-deed," an official of the agency said. Moreover, an official of the Noida Authority said that it issued 15 more recovery notices.

171.title: ICC releases latest ODI team rankings, England lose top spot
171.article_body: The ICC has released the latest ODI team rankings, with England losing their top spot following a 0-3 defeat against Australia in the recently concluded three-match ODI series. New Zealand are on top of the rankings with 114 rating points, while England are now second with 113 rating points. India are third, while Australia are ranked fourth.

172.title: SL cricketer Chamika Karunaratne banned for 1 year over indiscipline at T20 WC
172.article_body: Sri Lanka all-rounder Chamika Karunaratne has been handed a one-year ban by Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) over indiscipline. The 26-year-old was found to have breached multiple clauses of the SLC's player agreement during the recently concluded T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. The all-rounder pleaded guilty to all charges levelled against him. He has also been fined $5,000.

173.title: World’s 6th richest man Buffett donates $758 million in Berkshire shares to charity
173.article_body: Warren Buffett has donated Berkshire Hathaway's shares valued at more than $758 million to charities, including one named after his late wife. With a net worth of  $110.4 billion, 92-year-old Buffett is the world's sixth richest person.
