Suryakumar Yadav continues to be on top of the rankings and has a 54-rating point lead over second-placed Muhammad Rizwan.

347.title: Train operator prevents woman's suicide bid on Navi Mumbai railway track
347.article_body: A 54-year-old on-duty operator of a suburban train saved an 18-year-old woman who was lying on a railway track in Navi Mumbai on Tuesday. Prashant Konnur prevented the train from hitting the woman by applying emergency brakes on time. The woman had allegedly attempted suicide. Konnur counselled her and helped her board the women's compartment of the train.

348.title: Hyderabad teacher sentenced to 10 yrs in jail for molesting minor boy
348.article_body: A 49-year-old private teacher in Hyderabad, Ravindran Prakash, was sentenced to 10 years in prison for molesting a minor boy. In 2018, Saroornagar Police received a complaint from the boy's father alleging that the accused sexually assaulted him while he was on his way to attend tuition. The POCSO Court imposed a fine of ₹45,000 on Prakash, a repeat offender.

349.title: Pune man kidnapped, beaten to death over cricket betting; 2 bookies arrested
349.article_body: A 32-year-old man from Pune was allegedly kidnapped and beaten to death over cricket betting last week. Police have arrested two bookies in connection with the case. According to police, the deceased owed money to the bookies, who were threatening him and demanding money before his abduction. The man ran a construction business in the past but was currently unemployed.

350.title: Russia has nearly exhausted current stock of Iran-made weapons: UK
350.article_body: Britain's Defence Ministry has said that it is likely that Russia has nearly exhausted its current stock of Iran-made weapons and will seek to restock. Russia has likely launched a number of Iranian manufactured un-crewed aerial vehicles against Ukraine since September, the statement added. Iran and Russia have reportedly reached a deal to start production of attack drones in Russia.

351.title: New Zealand hikes interest rate to 4.25%, the highest since 2009
351.article_body: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand increased interest rate by a record 75 basis points to 4.25%,  the highest since early 2009. The central bank warned of an entire year in recession to rein in inflation. This is the first time the bank has raised rate by more than a half-point since the Official Cash Rate was introduced in 1999.

352.title: ICC releases all-time T20I batting rankings, Suryakumar just 2 points behind Kohli
352.article_body: The ICC today released the latest all-time T20I batting rankings, with India's Suryakumar Yadav breaking into the top five. Suryakumar achieved his career-best 895 rating points on November 20 and is now placed fifth on the all-time rankings. He is just two rating points behind third-ranked Virat Kohli, who had achieved his career-best 897 rating points on September 7, 2014.

353.title: False: Musk on reports of FTX Founder owning a $100 million stake in Twitter
353.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk has denied reports of bankrupt crypto exchange FTX's Founder and former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried owning a $100 million stake in Twitter. Responding to a tweet by a news website regarding the same, Musk responded, "False". Earlier, several message exchanges between Musk and Sam regarding the Twitter takeover had surfaced online.

354.title: Manoj Tiwari to become a father again at 51; shares celebration video
354.article_body: Actor-politician Manoj Tiwari is set to become a father for the third time at 51. He took to social media to share a video from his wife's baby shower and wrote, "Some happiness cannot be described in words...it can just be felt." The couple already have a daughter together and Manoj Tiwari also has a daughter from his ex-wife.

355.title: India & BJP have become synonymous: Gajendra Shekhawat in Gujarat
355.article_body: Campaigning for Gujarat elections, Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Shekhawat on Tuesday said that India and BJP have become synonymous. Claiming that the Congress party divided Gujarat on caste basis, Shekhawat at a rally in Gandhinagar said, "There was a time when our Gujarat, especially Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar were known as cities of riots."

356.title: Colorado gay nightclub shooting suspect who killed 5 is non-binary: Court filing
356.article_body: The alleged shooter who killed five people at a gay nightclub in US state of Colorado is non-binary and uses they/them pronouns, his legal team said. It has also been revealed that the 22-year-old shooter, Anderson Lee Aldrich, was known as Nicholas Franklin Brink until 2016. The suspect's father is a pornography performer with an extensive criminal history, records show.

357.title: Leopard spotted on IIT-Bombay campus; forest officials alerted
357.article_body: A distress call was made to the forest department on Monday morning after a leopard was allegedly spotted on the campus of IIT-Bombay. A forest official said, "Our teams are initiating all necessary actions." Leopards, which are generally nocturnal, can be spotted in the area in day too as the campus lies near the Sanjay Gandhi National Park, he added.

358.title: Wait time for US visitor visa reaches nearly 1,000 days in Delhi
358.article_body: The appointment waiting time for applicants of B-1 and B-2 visitor visas for the US has reached 961 days in Delhi, according to US State Department website. "The estimated wait time to receive...interview appointment...can change weekly and is based on actual incoming workload and staffing," it said. "These are estimates only and do not guarantee...availability of...appointment," the website read.

359.title: He can go to any level: Cong leader on Assam CM's 'Saddam Hussein' remark
359.article_body: Following Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma’s "Saddam Hussein" remark for Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, Congress’ Bhupen Kumar Borah said Sarma can go to any level for power. "You just want a headline and you get that only when you take Rahul Gandhi’s name. Himanta Biswa Sarma can say anything," he added. "We don’t pay attention," Borah stated.

360.title: India repatriates Pakistani national after he serves 10 years in jail
360.article_body: A Pakistani national, who had entered India illegally, was repatriated through the Attari-Wagah border on Tuesday after he served his 10-year-long jail term, an official confirmed. Kala Massi had allegedly entered India without a passport and visa in 2011 and was apprehended in Punjab's Majitha, where a pistol and cartridge were recovered from him. Massi hails from Pakistan's Narowal.

361.title: Ready to re-launch Jet Airways within 60-90 days of ownership transfer: CEO
361.article_body: Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor on Wednesday said that they are ready to re-launch within 60-90 days of the transfer of ownership. "There is no standoff between the lenders and the consortium. Both parties are working together for the implementation of the approved resolution plan," Kapoor added. Last week, Jet Airways reduced the salaries of nearly 33% of the employees.

362.title: Give us our pay: Shout workers as men smash cameras at China iPhone plant
362.article_body: People smashed surveillance cameras and windows at the world's largest iPhone factory run by Foxconn in China's Zhengzhou as the workers shouted, "Give us our pay!" Videos of the incident showed workers protesting and they were surrounded by people in full hazmat suits, some carrying batons. The protest reportedly started over unpaid wages and fear of spreading infection.

363.title: Didn't know what sexual harassment was before Bombshell: Margot Robbie
363.article_body: Actress Margot Robbie has said that she did not know the definition of sexual harassment before she worked in the 2019 film 'Bombshell'. "I always thought [sexual harassment] required physical contact for it to be considered illegal or wrong," Margot added. She stated that she was shocked to know that "any unwelcome sexual advances" was included in sexual harassment.

364.title: Rumours about new traffic fines in Hyderabad fake: Police
364.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have asked citizens not to believe in any rumours about "new traffic fines" in the city warning that those who are found spreading the fake information will be prosecuted as per law. The police further said that the fines against traffic violations are in accordance with 2011 guidelines issued in the erstwhile combined state of Andhra Pradesh.

365.title: B'luru man kills friend over money, goes to police with body in car
365.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for killing his friend in Bengaluru and taking his body to a police station in a car. According to the police, the deceased had taken over ₹2 crore from the accused's mother and some of her friends after promising to get her a loan at subsidised interest but refused to return the money.

366.title: Ex-US President Trump loses legal bid to prevent release of tax returns
366.article_body: The US Supreme Court has rejected former US President Donald Trump's emergency application which sought to prevent the Treasury Department from releasing his six years of tax returns to a congressional committee. The Democrat-controlled Ways and Means Committee, has been seeking Trump's tax returns since 2019. Trump's lawyers argued that the committee lacks legal basis for requesting tax returns.

367.title: 2 traffic violators beat up woman police & her colleagues in Pune; arrested
367.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have arrested two persons for allegedly beating up an on-duty woman traffic police and her colleagues at Dehu Phata chowk. The accused, Bhushan Jain and Dattatraya Kokare, allegedly manhandled and sexually molested the female police when she asked them to not use a closed road. When her colleagues tried to intervene, they also allegedly threw punches at them.

368.title: PMC to undertake beautification work ahead of G20 summit meetings in city
368.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has commenced preparations ahead of next year's G20 summit by undertaking road repair work in parts of the city where delegates may visit. "The civic administration has received 43 proposals for beautification of junctions and so far approved work for...12 junctions," an official said. Notably, a few summit meetings will also be held in Mumbai.

369.title: Car catches fire in Thane, no casualties reported
369.article_body: A Honda Mobility car at Hiranandani Meadows in Thane reportedly caught fire on Tuesday night. While the car was damaged, no casualties were reported in the incident. Thane's Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief Avinash Sawant said their team, along with fire brigade personnel and one fire vehicle, reached the spot and doused the fire within an hour.

370.title: Fake educational certificate racket busted in Hyderabad, 3 arrested
370.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested three people for selling fake educational certificates from various universities and supporting and VISA documents to needy students at the price of ₹50,000-₹60,000. According to police, the main accused used to run a flex designing unit. Among the other two accused, one used to work in an educational consultancy and other as a visa processing counsellor.

371.title: Shraddha's murder was well-planned & not heat of moment act, says expert
371.article_body: Apollo hospital's Senior Consultant Psychiatrist, Dr Sandeep Vohra, on Tuesday said that Shraddha's murder was a well-planned move and not an act that could've happened in the heat of the moment. He said that the way Aftab acted after killing Shraddha can only be done by someone who has psychopathic traits, adding that the accused has no remorse.

372.title: Meghalaya villagers burn down forest office in Assam district
372.article_body: A group of villagers from Meghalaya burned down a forest office in Assam's West Karbi Anglong district, said officials. The incident occurred soon after six people died in firing during a clash between Assam Police and Meghalaya villagers at the interstate border. Villagers, carrying machetes, rods and sticks, torched furniture, documents and motorcycles parked in the complex, officials added.

373.title: Satyendar Jain enjoying resort-like facilities in Tihar jail: Lekhi
373.article_body: AAP leader Satyendar Jain is enjoying facilities similar to a holiday resort inside Tihar jail, Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi said. Her statement came after a new CCTV footage from Tihar jail showed Jain getting "proper food" in jail. "There's food being served on a platter, masseur facility is available, it isn't a luxury resort," Lekhi stated.

374.title: UP CM Yogi launches 755 projects worth ₹878 crore in Ghaziabad
374.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath inaugurated and laid the foundation stone for 755 projects worth a total of about ₹878 crore in Ghaziabad on Tuesday. During the event, Adityanath said that before 2017, the city was among the "dirtiest and no investments came here", however, now it has an expressway and "the country's first rapid train will also commence here".

375.title: SpaceX launches Eutelsat 10B mission from Florida's Cape Canaveral
375.article_body: SpaceX on Tuesday launched Eutelsat 10B communications satellite from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida. The satellite, launched using a Falcon 9 rocket, will provide internet service to air and sea traffic. The Elon Musk-led space company on Monday said weather was 20% favourable and delayed the launch to allow for additional pre-flight checkouts.

376.title: Musk finds closet full of '#StayWoke' t-shirts at Twitter headquarters
376.article_body: Elon Musk found a closet full of t-shirts with '#StayWoke' written on them at Twitter's headquarters in San Francisco and shared a video of the closet on Twitter. Twitter's former CEO Jack Dorsey popularised the t-shirts following the killing of 18-year-old Michael Brown in the US. It was a call for awareness against the alleged police violence against Black people.

377.title: Karnataka court stays distribution, sale of book on Tipu Sultan
377.article_body: A court in Karnataka stayed the distribution and sale of a book on Tipu Sultan, titled 'Tipu Nija Kanasugalu' (Real Dreams of Tipu). This comes after former Chairman of the District Wakf Board Committee, BS Rafiulla, filed a suit contending the book contains incorrect information on Tipu Sultan and that it could cause unrest and communal disharmony.

378.title: Man beaten to death over non-payment of debt in Pune; 2 arrested
378.article_body: Two repeat offenders were arrested after a 32-year-old man was beaten to death over non-payment of debt in Pune, officials said on Tuesday. The deceased had borrowed ₹28,000 from one of the accused, according to officials. The deceased's wife claimed that the accused had called her husband for a meeting in Bibwewadi earlier this month, then kidnapped and killed him.

379.title: Delhivery stock falls by 5.3% to 52-week low after large trade report
379.article_body: Shares of logistics company Delhivery fell by 5.3% to a 52-week low of ₹317/piece after reports of a large trade. Delhivery shares were trading with cuts in the sixth straight trading session. Bloomberg data showed at least 12.8 lakh shares changed hands in large trade. At 1:47 pm, the company's stock was trading 4.42% lower at ₹320.10/share on the NSE.

380.title: 1 dead in twin blasts in Jerusalem, police says 'Haven't seen such attack in years'
380.article_body: Two explosions at bus stops on Jerusalem's outskirts killed one and wounded up to 15 people on Wednesday, emergency services said. The Israeli police said it appeared to be an attack by Palestinian militants. Israel's police chief Kobi Shabtai said, "We haven't seen such an attack in years," adding that police are searching for more possible explosives in the city.

381.title: Mumbai local train services disrupted after commuter gets hit by train
381.article_body: Mumbai's suburban local train services were acutely disrupted on Wednesday morning due to a case of trespassing between Borivali and Kandivali. Nearly three-four trains were affected after a person was hit by train, according to the Western Railway officials. The person who was hit has been taken to a nearby hospital, the officials added.

382.title: German Catholic Church amends law to allow LGBTQ employees to work
382.article_body: The Catholic Church in Germany has amended its law stating that all employees can be representatives of a church that serves people, independent of their sexual identity. The amendment comes after 125 employees of the Catholic Church came out as queer in a demonstration. Earlier, Catholic Church employees could lose their jobs for being open about having a same-sex partner.

383.title: It's hard to watch him bat, embarrassing: Maxwell on Suryakumar's 111*
383.article_body: Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said Suryakumar Yadav is batting on a "completely different" planet, adding that his 111* in the second T20I against New Zealand was "hard to watch". "It's embarrassing that he's so much better than everyone else," stated Maxwell. Talking about Suryakumar potentially playing in the Big Bash League, Maxwell said, "We won't be able to afford him."

384.title: How long will CM Sangma let Assam CM take Meghalaya for granted?: TMC MP
384.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Tuesday said that he was "deeply saddened" by the firing incident at the Assam-Meghalaya border that left six persons, including an Assam forest official, dead. Adding that the incident showed the Meghalaya government's "ineptitude", he further said, "For how long will CM Conrad Sangma allow [Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma] to take Meghalaya for granted?"

385.title: Accepted small roles for survival, had no alternative: Nawazuddin
385.article_body: While revisiting his journey in Bollywood, actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui revealed that he accepted small roles to survive in the film industry. "I had no other alternative," he said, adding that it is the "difficult time that makes you strong". He shared that before becoming an actor, he worked as a chemist in a petrochemical company for a short while.

386.title: The fire has spread in the jungle: Kaif on Shreyas' golden duck vs NZ
386.article_body: Discussing Shreyas Iyer's dismissal for a golden duck in India's third T20I against New Zealand, Mohammad Kaif said, "The fire has spread in the jungle, everyone knows how Shreyas plays against the short ball." "Hard length, short ball, a slip was placed. Every bowler bowls...[bouncers to] Shreyas," added Kaif. Shreyas scored 13 runs in the T20I series against New Zealand.

387.title: 2 men molest female constable in Pune after being stopped at no-vehicle zone
387.article_body: A female traffic constable was allegedly molested and pushed to ground in Pune while her male colleague was attacked by two men whom she stopped after they tried to force their way into a no-vehicle zone created for a pilgrimage in Alandi, police said. They were arrested. One of them allegedly grabbed her by the chest and pushed her hard.

388.title: Who was ex-poll body chief TN Seshan for whom SC said 'Seshan happens once in a while'?
388.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday praised former Chief Election Commissioner TN Seshan, saying, "Seshan happens once in a while". Seshan is credited for major electoral reforms as he introduced a list of 150 malpractices during elections, including liquor distribution, bribing, use of religion in speeches. He introduced voter ID cards, Model Code of Conduct, and enforced a limit to poll expenses.

389.title: Actress Aindrila Sharma's boyfriend kisses her feet at her funeral
389.article_body: The boyfriend of actress Aindrila Sharma, who passed away on Sunday in Kolkata, was seen kneeling before her body and kissing her feet at her funeral. Videos on social media also showed Sabyasachi Chowdhury performing the last rites with Aindrila's father. Sabyasachi appears to have deleted his social media accounts following Aindrila's demise.

390.title: Musk blocked Twitter staff's corporate cards, refused to reimburse travel bills: Report
390.article_body: After taking over Twitter, Elon Musk blocked employees' corporate credit cards, a report by The New York Times said. Musk reportedly refused to reimburse travel invoices of current and former employees, while his staff said that the services were authorised by the company’s former management and not him. His staff is said to have been avoiding calls from travel vendors.

391.title: Meesho joins ONDC to support inclusive e-commerce ecosystem
391.article_body: Bengaluru-based online retailer Meesho announced its integration with the government's Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC). The pilot will be launched in Bengaluru and gradually rolled out in other locations over the coming months, it said. The move will help connect buyers with hyperlocal sellers and support India's vision of creating an inclusive e-commerce ecosystem, the startup said.

392.title: Hyderabad police constable saves electrocuted man by giving CPR
392.article_body: A police constable of Banjara Hill Traffic Police Station in Hyderabad performed Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) to save a man who suffered an electric shock on Tuesday evening. This incident took place near GVK House’s main gate. After administering CPR, the police constable, A Shankar, called an ambulance and took the man to a nearby hospital.

393.title: I was obsessed with my body & weight at 17: Alia Bhatt
393.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that at the age of 17, she was obsessed with her body and her weight. She admitted that the obsession “took a toll” on her. The actress further shared that during her pregnancy, she felt “comfortable”, “happy and more at peace” with her body. Alia recently welcomed her first child, a baby girl.

394.title: 35 illegal structures on Pune's Navale bridge service roads razed
394.article_body: At least 35 illegal constructions have been demolished by the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) on service roads along the Navale bridge on the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway in Pune, the police said. The step was taken after a truck had hit several vehicles on Sunday and caused a pile-up on the highway leaving several people injured.

395.title: Son hospitalised after CRPF beat him, not allowed to see him: Malla Reddy on I-T raids
395.article_body: Telangana Labour Minister Chamakura Malla Reddy has claimed that his elder son has been hospitalised after being beaten "entire night" by CRPF personnel, who accompanied Income Tax Department officials during raids at several places linked to him. "They are not allowing my son's doctor to visit him. They are not even allowing me to see him," he added.

396.title: Stop all construction work on Sukhatal near Naini Lake: HC to govt
396.article_body: The Uttarakhand High Court on Tuesday ordered the government to stop all construction activities on the bed of Sukhatal, which is less than a kilometre from Naini Lake in Nainital. This comes after a group of 104 local activists and citizens wrote to the HC Chief Justice, who took suo moto cognizance of the matter.

397.title: Working closely with law enforcement: Walmart after fatal shooting in US store
397.article_body: Several people died and many others were injured after a shooting took place at a Walmart store in Virginia on Tuesday night. Sharing a statement about the same, Walmart tweeted, "We are shocked at this tragic event at our Chesapeake, Virginia store. We're praying for those impacted...We’re working closely with law enforcement, and we are focused on supporting our associates."

398.title: Felt I could play in T20 WC 2022, not being there really hurt: Venkatesh
398.article_body: All-rounder Venkatesh Iyer said he felt "really hurt" as he wasn't able to represent India in the T20 World Cup 2022. "I don't want to put myself in a position to think about something which is really far away from me," added Venkatesh. "I would have wanted to be there, but again it is not in my hands," he stated.

399.title: Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra enters Madhya Pradesh
399.article_body: After a two-day break, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi-led Bharat Jodo Yatra resumed as it entered Madhya Pradesh on Wednesday. The foot march resumed from Boderli village in the Burhanpur district. Former MP CMs Kamal Nath and Digvijaya Singh joined Gandhi in the march. The party is aiming to pass through seven districts of the state over the next 11 days.

400.title: Ukraine promises shelter, electricity, internet to people as winter nears
400.article_body: Ukrainian government has promised to provide shelters with heat and water to people and encouraged them to save energy as winter approaches. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that special "invincibility centres" will be set up around the country to provide electricity, internet, mobile phone connections and a pharmacy free of cost and around the clock.

401.title: Ex-Niti Aayog VC Rajiv Kumar joins India Sotheby's advisory board
401.article_body: Former Vice Chairman of the Niti Aayog Rajiv Kumar has joined India Sotheby's International Realty's policy and advisory board. Kumar will advise the company on policy and advocacy matters with the objective of promoting transparency and professionalism in the real estate sector, India Sotheby's International Realty said. Kumar is an alumnus of St Stephen's College and Lucknow University.

402.title: 2 assault revenue officers, tear land records in GB Nagar village
402.article_body: A case has been filed after two suspects threatened, abused and assaulted revenue officers in a village in Gautam Buddha Nagar's Dadri, police said. The accused also tore land records when the revenue officers reached the village to measure land parcels. Police personnel were accompanying the revenue officers, however, they left midway due to some confusion over jurisdiction, officials said.
